padding: 14px 20px 0px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-position: 0% 0%;" data-cellinner="cell1"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell1" data-innereditablearea="cell1" data-maincontent="1"><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;">Welcome to the September 2017&nbsp;<br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;">American Psychology-Law Society (AP-LS) Newsletter.<img width="264" height="173" title="" align="right" alt="" src="/resources/Pictures/forensic-assessment-services.jpg" border="0"></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"><br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;">Our monthly Newsletter provides information about activities, upcoming events, and resources to connect the psychology-law community.</div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"><br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;">AP-LS aspires to excel as a valuable, effective, and influential organization advancing the science of psychology-law and the translation of psychology-law knowledge into practice and policy. &nbsp;</div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"><br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;">The AP-LS Newsletter is evolving. The Newsletter will be published monthy via email, in a style similar to the E-News format developed by Tess Neal. Material formerly published in the quarterly PDF Newsletter will be available online, with content hyperlinks in the monthly email Newsletters. Marc Patry is the new Newsletter Editor, and Leah Georges is the Associate Editor. <br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"><br></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"></div><div align="center" style="line-height: 20px;"><table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tbody><tr><td align="left" valign="top" style="line-height: 1px;"><table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tbody><tr><td height="1" align="center" valign="top" style="background-color: rgb(219, 220, 221); background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-position: 0% 0%;" data-cellinner="cell2"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell2" data-innereditablearea="cell2"><p><font style="font-size: 20px;"><strong><strong><font style="font-size: 20px;">AP-LS 2018 CONFERENCE CALL<br></font></strong></strong></font></p><p><br>Mark your calendars, the 2018 AP-LS conference will be held March 8th - 10th, 2018! We are excited to host everyone at the grand Peabody Hotel in Memphis, Tennessee.<br><br>Beginning September 1st, the submission site for the AP-LS 2018 conference Call for Proposals will be available at <a href="http://conferences.ap-ls.org" target="_blank">conferences.ap-ls.org</a>. The deadline for submissions is September 29th, 2017. Here are some exciting new things to be aware of:<br><br></p><ul><li>The submission platform this year allows reviewers to register on the same site, so when you register for the site, consider signing up to review at the same time! We also encourage students to review proposals this year.</li></ul><ul><li>Consider submitting a Psycho-legal Data-blitz! What is a data-blitz? A data blitz is a series of 5-minute talks (limit 3 slides), covering a bite-sized piece of psycho-legal research. The sessions will offer a fast-paced overview of the most exciting research emerging in psychology and law. Data-blitz sessions will include top-rated papers and will not be organized by topic (great for research and legal scholarship that does not traditionally fit with other AP-LS sessions!)<br></li></ul><p>If you have any questions, please contact the 2018 conference co-chairs <a href="mailto:druhnn@icloud.com">Nicholas Druhn</a> and <a href="mailto:slwylie@unomaha.edu">Lindsey Wylie</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><font style="font-size: 20px;"><strong><strong><font style="font-size: 20px;">REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS:</font></strong></strong></font> <br></p><p><u><font style="font-size: 20px;">$1,000 APF <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/WeissRFP2017.pdf" target="_blank">Weiss Grant</a></font></u></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">The American Psychological Foundation’s (APF) 2017 Drs. Rosalee G. And Raymond A. Weiss Research and Program Innovation Grant</font><font style="font-size: 16px;"> supports graduate students and early career researchers conducting innovative research, education, and intervention efforts that advance psychological knowledge and application in APF’s priority areas.</font></p><p>See our website for more information <a href="http://www.apa.org/apf/funding/weiss.aspx">http://www.apa.org/apf/funding/weiss.aspx</a></p><p>The deadline for applications is <strong>September 15, 2017</strong>.&nbsp; <br></p></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td><td width="200" align="" class="cellContainer cell3Container" valign="top">									<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">										<tbody><tr>											<td class="cellOuter" valign="top" style="padding: 0px;" data-cellouter="cell3">												<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" data-cellborder="1">													<tbody><tr>														<td class="cellInner" valign="top" style="padding: 14px 7px 0px 8px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-position: 0% 0%;" data-cellinner="cell3"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell3" data-innereditablearea="cell3"><p><font style="font-size: 20px;"><strong>AP-LS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MINUTES</strong></font></p>Meeting minutes from the EC meeting of March 16, 2017, are available <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/APLSMarch2017ECminutes.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.
